div.h2: NHS England APIM Base API Definitions

blockquote.p: Any FHIR capability may be 'allowed' by the system unless explicitly marked as "SHALL NOT". A few items are marked as MAY in the Implementation Guide to highlight their potential relevance to the use case.

div.p: The summary table lists the resources that are part of this configuration, and for each resource it lists:

ul.li: The interactions supported by each resource (Read, Search, Update, and Create, are always shown, while VRead, Patch, Delete, History on Instance, or History on Type are only present if at least one of the resources has support for them.

li.span: The required, recommended, and some optional search parameters (if any).

ul.li: The operations on the resource (if any)

b.title: GET all set of resources of the type (search interaction)
PUT a new resource version (update interaction)

tr.td: _id, Organization.identifier, identifier, active, type, name, address-country, ods-role, ods-lastChangeDate, ods-activeRole
_fuzzy-match, _exact-match, _history, _max-results, identifier, family, given, gender, birthdate, death-date, address-postalcode, address-postcode, general-practitioner, email, phone

ul.li: SHOULD support read, create, update, delete, search-type.

div.p: API present in

ul.li: National Record Locator - FHIR API v3 as STU3

div.p: No UK Core FHIR Access conformance requirements

li.a: National Record Locator - FHIR API v3

div.p: International and Care Connect API suggest using patient instead of subject, this would also be consistent with other NHS England API's

ul.li: This may not be correct and is inferred from A005 e-Referral Service - FHIR API
SHOULD support read, delete, update, search-type.

div.p: API present in
No UK Core FHIR Access conformance requirements

ul.li: Booking and Referral - FHIR API believe this should be identifier

ul.li: Booking and Referral - FHIR API believe this should be organization:identifier
Booking and Referral - FHIR API believe this should be identifier

Used by

e-Referral FHIR API

ul.li: Booking and Referral - FHIR API believe this should be identifier
Organisation Data Service - FHIR API EPS expects this data to be type
Organisation Data Service - FHIR API FHIR developers would expect this to be _lastUpdated
Organisation Data Service - FHIR API concerned we have two searches on an extension

div.p: API present in
No UK Core FHIR Access conformance requirements
API present in:
Used by
SHOULD and SHALL conformance is taken from UK Core FHIR Access - MAY is used to indicate no conformance (added due to rendering issue in the publisher)
A search by NHS Number. Missing from PDS is a read operation instead - so using transient id instead of identifier
PDS using non standard parameter
PDS is using non standard parameter. Do not believe this is :exact from modifiers although it sounds similar and may cause confusion
PDS is using non standard parameter. Do not believe this is _history from history this probably results in confusion for developers
PDS is using non standard parameter. PDS probably should be using _count _count which should be ok as PDS does not support paging
PDS is using non standard parameter - will be deprecated in the future

A search by ODS Code. PDS SHOULD be using general-practitioner:identifier with token type to follow NHS Digital FHIR policy. It is workable as it is but this is searching on an id which is transient (changeable), searching on identifier is recommended.
API present in
No UK Core FHIR Access conformance requirements
API present in
No UK Core FHIR Access conformance requirements

e-Referral FHIR API - This parameter is NOT present but is believed to be implied. This API is believed to be NOT CONFORMANT as the api as currently stated should return all PractitionreRole's held by eRS and this is clearly not correct.
API present in
No UK Core FHIR Access conformance requirements)
A search by NHS Number. Proxy query parameter and not supported on PDS
A search by NHS Number. Proxy uses query parameter and PDS uses path parameter
API present in
No UK Core FHIR Access conformance requirements

ul.li: Booking and Referral - FHIR API believe this should be identifier same as eRS

title.value: NHS England APIM Base API Definitions

description.value: High level summary of FHIR api's used within NHS England API programmes

documentation.value:

Used by
- EPS consumers.
SHOULD and SHALL conformance is taken from [UK Core FHIR Access](https://build.fhir.org/ig/HL7-UK/UK-Core-Access/index.html) - MAY is used to indicate no conformance (added due to rendering issue in the publisher)
PDS using non standard parameter
PDS is using non standard parameter. Do not believe this is :exact from [modifiers](https://www.hl7.org/fhir/r4/search.html#modifiers) although it sounds similar and may cause confusion
PDS is using non standard parameter. Do not believe this is _history from [history](https://www.hl7.org/fhir/r4/http.html#history) this probably results in confusion for developers
PDS is using non standard parameter. PDS probably should be using _count [_count](https://www.hl7.org/fhir/r4/search.html#count) which should be ok as PDS does not support paging
A search by NHS Number. Missing from PDS is a read operation instead - so using transient id instead of identifier
PDS is using non standard parameter - **will be deprecated in the future**

A search by ODS Code. PDS SHOULD be using `general-practitioner:identifier` with `token` type to follow NHS Digital FHIR policy. It is workable as it is but this is searching on an `id` which is transient (changeable), searching on `identifier` is recommended.

API present in - [e-Referral FHIR API](https://digital.nhs.uk/developer/api-catalogue/e-referral-service-fhir)
No [UK Core FHIR Access](https://build.fhir.org/ig/HL7-UK/UK-Core-Access/index.html) conformance requirements
- e-Referral FHIR API

API present in - [e-Referral FHIR API](https://digital.nhs.uk/developer/api-catalogue/e-referral-service-fhir) (NOT CONFORMANT)
No [UK Core FHIR Access](https://build.fhir.org/ig/HL7-UK/UK-Core-Access/index.html) conformance requirements

[e-Referral FHIR API](https://digital.nhs.uk/developer/api-catalogue/e-referral-service-fhir) - This parameter is NOT present but is believed to be implied. This API is believed to be NOT CONFORMANT as the api as currently stated should return all PractitionreRole's held by eRS and this is clearly not correct.

API present in - [Personal Demographics Service FHIR API](https://digital.nhs.uk/developer/api-catalogue/personal-demographics-service-fhir) - Proxy.
No [UK Core FHIR Access](https://build.fhir.org/ig/HL7-UK/UK-Core-Access/index.html) conformance requirements)
A search by NHS Number. Proxy query parameter and not supported on PDS
A search by NHS Number. Proxy uses query parameter and PDS uses path parameter

No [UK Core FHIR Access](https://build.fhir.org/ig/HL7-UK/UK-Core-Access/index.html) conformance requirements
